sense.name: to wind or move in a spiral course
sense.examples: The muscles of his body were coiling for action. There was black smoke coiling up into the sky. The young people coiled on the dance floor.

sense.name: make a ceramic artform by connecting ropes
sense.examples: This famous potter coils all of her vessels. Elementary school students coil pots during art. Experienced artists are adept at coiling pots, plates, and cups.

sense.name: wind around something in coils or loops
sense.examples: The cowboy coiled his rope around his arm. I coiled the hose and put it away when I was done using it. Sharon coiled wire around a pencil to form even loops.
